availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel G. Martin (Monroe County, Kentucky, constable and soldier in the 37th KY)

body.p: Monroe County, Kentucky, constable and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of George Martin and Mary Martin. Student in Monroe County, Kentucky, in 1850. Constable in Monroe County in 1860. Served in Company A 37th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from September 17, 1863, to December 29, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 394A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, Precinct 4, p. 1123.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 419.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 370.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #203627, Certificate #192685.
